ch.uzh.ifi.csg.cloudsim.rda.useraware

Interface RdaUserAwareVmScheduler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VmSchedulerDRFMH, VmSchedulerGreedinessAllocationAlgorithm

    public interface RdaUserAwareVmScheduler
    VM Schedulers to be used within the RDA module, must either implement this interface or the RdaVmScheduler.
    Author:
    Patrick A. Taddei
    See Also:
    RdaVmScheduler

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void allocateResourcesForAllVms(double currentTime, List<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.Vm> vms, Map<String,Float> userPriorities)
      This is the corresponding method for VmScheduler.allocatePesForVm() Hosts, supporting this interface, should throw an UnsupportedOperationException when calling this default method.
      Map<String,Float> getUserPriorities(double currentTime, List<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.Vm> vms)
      To retrieve the priorities of all users/customers that have a running VM on this host.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserPriorities

        Map<String,Float> getUserPriorities(double currentTime,
                                  List<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.Vm> vms)
        To retrieve the priorities of all users/customers that have a running VM on this host.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - The current simulation time.
        vms - the VMs to be taken into account
        Returns:
        A map, that contains the priority associated with each user.

      • allocateResourcesForAllVms

        void allocateResourcesForAllVms(double currentTime,
                              List<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.Vm> vms,
                              Map<String,Float> userPriorities)
        This is the corresponding method for VmScheduler.allocatePesForVm() Hosts, supporting this interface, should throw an UnsupportedOperationException when calling this default method.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - The current simulation time.
        priorities -
        vm - A map, that contains the priority associated with each user.
